EnglishScore: English proficiency must be demonstrated by any one of the following: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 5.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; successful completion of ELS (English Language Services) Level 112; four years of study at a U.S. high school without ESL coursework; graduation from a secondary school in a native English-speaking country; or at least 24 semester hours of transferable credit from a U.S. college/university with a 2.00 GPA, including the equivalent of ENGL 1010 & 1020 with grades of 'C' or better.

All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL score of 500 (paper-based) or 61 (internet-based), IELTS score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo English Test score of 90, or Completion of ELS Language Center's Level 109.

Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (71 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), or Duolingo (95). Other ways to meet the requirement include completion of the MTSU Intensive English Program (IEP), successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112, graduation from a high school in the United States, or completion of 24 transferable semester hours from an accredited U.S. college or university.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to meet English proficiency requirements: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (pBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 5.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English test; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.

All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (minimum 500 PBT or 61 iBT), IELTS (minimum 5.5), PTE Academic (minimum 48), Duolingo English Test (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112. Other exemptions are also available.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted proofs include a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 71, TOEFL PBT score of 525, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 54, Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 112, among other options.

Undergraduate applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable tests include TOEFL (minimum 71 iBT/525 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum 48), Duolingo (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Level 112.

International undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by achieving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL iBT score of 61, TOEFL paper-based test score of 500, IELTS overall band score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, Michigan English Test (MET) score of 53, or International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) score of 3.6. Completion of level 109 of the ELS Language Centers program also fulfills this requirement. Waivers are available under certain conditions.

For international applicants from non-English speaking countries, demonstration of English proficiency is required. This can be met by submitting a minimum score from one of the following tests: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (45), Duolingo (85), or by successfully completing ELS Language Center's Level 112, among other options.

Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by providing an official score report from one of the following exams. All scores must be less than two years old.

Exemptions are available for students from certain English-speaking countries or those who have completed specific English coursework.

Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 also meets this requirement.

For international students from non-English speaking countries, proof of English proficiency is required.
